availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Josiah Winden Staggs (Lewis County, Kentucky, farmer. )

body.p: Lewis County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Yewlett Staggs in Lewis County, Kentucky, in 1840. Father of James R. Staggs, Serepta A. Staggs, Nancy J. Staggs, Alfred Staggs, Thomas Staggs, Granville Staggs, Sarah R. Staggs, and John B. Staggs. Farmer in Lewis County in 1850. Farmer in Lewis County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lewis County, District 1, p. 236A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lewis County, p. 915.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lewis County, Laurel Precinct, p. 475B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Lewis County Marriages, Film 000344051.
Lewis County Historical Society, Pioneer Families of Lewis County, Kentucky, Indexed, (Mt. Vernon, IN: Windmill Publications, 1996), 190.
"Josiah Wilden Staggs (1817-1894)," Find A Grave, Memorial 81691353, accessed September 13, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/81691353.
